message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
 • Total liabilities can be obtained from the balance sheet by subtracting Owner’s Equity from Total Assets.
  – Total Assets = 14,799,664.61 
  – Total Owner’s Equity = 14,167,783.63 
  – Therefore, Total Liabilities = 14,799,664.61 – 14,167,783.63 = 631,880.98
 • Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 631,880.98 / 14,799,664.61 ≈ 0.04273 (which we can round to 0.04)

Step 2. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio.
 • From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –1,368,775.90
 • From the income statement, Net Profit = 1,167,783.63
 • Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit = –1,368,775.90 / 1,167,783.63 ≈ –1.17274 (which we can round to –1.17)

Thus, the solution in the requested JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.04",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-1.17"
  }
}
